column4: can anyone help me with my problem: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=9668826
I'm getting these big [  xxx.xxxxxx] ata1.00: status: { DRDY ERR } errors
I would start looking for a new hard drive.. I don't think those errors are due to file system errors
I assume you've tried the regular things.. ie shutting down the system, letting it cool off and such.. running fsck from a live cd, making sure motherboard is ok, power supply and such
Really?  Its been working fine for several months, and brand new
I've done the stuff up to fsck from a live CD, it gave a "/bin/sh: fsck: not found" when I used the "Ubuntu Server 10.4 Install CD"
you could also try a clean install .. see if the errors appear again
you could also have a look at the s.m.a.r.t info .. see if it tells you anything
I don't know how to check the motherboard/power supply
if you run from a live cd there is a neat little utility to see the smart info.. system, administration, disk utility I think
from that utility you can run some extra tests.. those take anywhere from 5 minutes to several hours to run.. but it's a good way to test the drive
I don't really want to try to do a complete reinstall as the errors could just start up again - I don't know what's caused them
where should I get a live CD from? (iso)
then give the sm.a.r.t utility a try.. hang on.. let me find the url for you
